IPACharInfo.Name: NON-STD IPA - Exclamation Point - Use U+01C3 (ǃ) instead
NON-STD IPA - Apostrophe - Use U+02C8 (ˈ) instead
NON-STD IPA - Colon - Use U+02D0 (ː) instead
NON-STD IPA - Lower case G - Use U+0261 (ɡ) instead
OBSOLETE IPA - small letter c with hook - Voiceless palatal implosive
OBSOLETE IPA - Replaced with labialized z or ð
OBSOLETE IPA - small letter k with hook - voiceless velar implosive
OBSOLETE IPA - Small letter p with hook - Replace with voiceless bilabial implosive
OBSOLETE IPA - Small letter t wtih hook - Replace with voiceless alveolar implosive
NON-STD IPA - d with curl
IPACharInfo.Description: Voiced palatalized postalveolar (alveolo-palatal) plosive, used by Sinologists

IPACharInfo.Name: NON-STD IPA - n with curl
IPACharInfo.Description: Voiced palatalized postalveolar (alveolo-palatal) nasal, used by Sinologists

IPACharInfo.Name: NON-STD IPA - t with curl
IPACharInfo.Description: Voiceless palatalized postalveolar (alveolo-palatal) plosive, used by Sinologists

IPACharInfo.Name: ALTERNATIVE IPA - shwa with rhoticized - Use shwa with diacritic instead
ALTERNATIVE IPA - reversed open e with hook - use reversed open e with diacritic instead
OBSOLETE IPA - Iota - Replaced with U+026A
Lower case L with Middle Tilde
OBSOLETE IPA - Closed Omega - Replaced with U+028A
OBSOLETE IPA - Long-leg R - Replaced with U+0072 U+031D
IPACharInfo.Description: Voiced strident apico-alveolar trill (e.g. Czech ř)

IPACharInfo.Name: NON-STD IPA! Reversed fishhook R - 007A 0329
IPACharInfo.Description: Apical Dental unrounded syllabic alveolar fricative - used by Sinologists

IPACharInfo.Name: NON-STD IPA! Reversed fishhook R with tail. U0290 U0329
IPACharInfo.Description: Apical retroflex unrounded syllabic alveolar fricative - used by Sinologists

IPACharInfo.Name: OBSOLETE IPA - Curly-tail esh withdrawn 1989, Replaced with [ɕ]
OBSOLETE IPA - Inverted t - Replaced with U+01C0
OBSOLETE IPA - Curly-tail ezh, withdrawn 1989, Replaced with [ʑ]
OBSOLETE IPA - Inverted glottal stop - Replaced with U+01C1
OBSOLETE IPA - Stretched C - Replaced with U+01C3
NON-STD IPA! Closed Epsilon. A mistake for U+025E
OBSOLETE IPA - small letter q with hook - voiceless uvular implosive
ALTERNATIVE IPA - Small letter digraph dz - Use d z with or without tiebar
ALTERNATIVE IPA - small letter d ezh digraph - Use d ezh with or without tiebar instead
ALTERNATIVE IPA - Small letter dz with curl - Use d z with curl
ALTERNATIVE IPA - small letter ts digraph - Use t s with or without tiebar instead
ALTERNATIVE IPA - Small letter tesh digraph - Use t esh with or without tiebar
ALTERNATIVE IPA - tc digraph with curl - Use t c with curl with or without tiebar instead
IPA Disordered speech - Small letter ls digraph
IPA Disordered Speech - small letter lz digraph
IPACharInfo.Description: Voiced lateral alveolar fricative (IPA for voiced lisp)

IPACharInfo.Name: IPA Disordered Speech - Bilabial percussive
IPACharInfo.Description: Bilabial Percussive - IPA for audible lip smack

IPACharInfo.Name: IPA Disordered Speech - Bidental Percussive
IPACharInfo.Description: Bidental Percussive - IPA for audible teeth gnashing

IPACharInfo.Name: NON-STD IPA - turned h with fishhook - Replaced with U+007A U+0329 U+02B7
IPACharInfo.Description: Apical Dental Rounded Syllabic Alveolar Fricative - used by Sinologists

IPACharInfo.Name: NON-STD IPA - turned h with fishhook and tail - Replaced with U+0290 U+0329 U+02B7
IPACharInfo.Description: Apical Dental Rounded Syllabic Retroflex Fricative - used by Sinologists

IPACharInfo.Name: NON-STD IPA - superscript small letter h with hook - Use U+0324 instead (s̤)
ALTERNATIVE IPA - Primary stress mark - use U+02C8 instead
OBSOLETE IPA - Subscript left hook, superseded 1989 by superscript j
OBSOLETE IPA - subscript w - replaced with superscript w
OBSOLETE IPA - Replaced with labialized theta.
NON-STD IPA - small capital A - Replaced with U+00E4
IPACharInfo.Description: Open central vowel used by Sinologists, between [a] and [ɑ], = [ä] used unofficially as an open central vowel

IPACharInfo.Name: NON-STD IPA - small capital E - used by Sinologists
IPACharInfo.Description: mid front unrounded vowel between [e] and [ɛ]
